text: I don't think the reason I can get the
best deal for everyone on brexit as a
European citizen I feel I've not been
listened to I feel I've been excluded
from making a decision on breakfast I've
been running a business in Edinburgh for
the last ten years and this is the first
year when I feel like I don't want to
pay my taxes to Westminster anymore
because for me it feels like I'm
supporting and funding my own
discrimination the most depressing thing
for me is that overnight I felt my
identity was taken away from me because
instead of being a European citizen
exercising my rights and being equal of
the Sun I was pushed into this other
narrative where I'm migrant an effete I
have worked 20 years to build a future
here to build my home here that's now an
uncertainty and I don't think the rules
can be changed retrospectively grexit to
me was a huge shock
I stayed up all night to watch the
results and when he was clearly lucky
that one I II cried for a long time and
a strong emotional response and my
entire life was messed up I still keep
hoping that there's not going to happen
and where I live my windows go into a
newsagent and every day when I have my
breakfast
I see the headlines of newspapers and I
almost stopped having my breakfast
because it's so exciting
